lines.text: Enter ISABELLA and FRANCISCA

lines.speaker: isabella
lines.text: And have you nuns no farther privileges?

lines.speaker: francisca
lines.text: Are not these large enough?

lines.speaker: isabella
lines.text: Yes, truly; I speak not as desiring more; But rather wishing a more strict restraint Upon the sisterhood, the votarists of Saint Clare.

lines.speaker: lucio
lines.text: [Within]  Ho! Peace be in this place!

lines.speaker: isabella
lines.text: Who's that which calls?

lines.speaker: francisca
lines.text: It is a man's voice. Gentle Isabella, Turn you the key, and know his business of him; You may, I may not; you are yet unsworn. When you have vow'd, you must not speak with men But in the presence of the prioress: Then, if you speak, you must not show your face, Or, if you show your face, you must not speak. He calls again; I pray you, answer him.
Exit

lines.speaker: isabella
lines.text: Peace and prosperity! Who is't that calls
Enter LUCIO

lines.speaker: lucio
lines.text: Hail, virgin, if you be, as those cheek-roses Proclaim you are no less! Can you so stead me As bring me to the sight of Isabella, A novice of this place and the fair sister To her unhappy brother Claudio?

lines.speaker: isabella
lines.text: Why 'her unhappy brother'? let me ask, The rather for I now must make you know I am that Isabella and his sister.

lines.speaker: lucio
lines.text: Gentle and fair, your brother kindly greets you: Not to be weary with you, he's in prison.

lines.speaker: isabella
lines.text: Woe me! for what?

lines.speaker: lucio
lines.text: For that which, if myself might be his judge, He should receive his punishment in thanks: He hath got his friend with child.

lines.speaker: isabella
lines.text: Sir, make me not your story.

lines.speaker: lucio
lines.text: It is true. I would not--though 'tis my familiar sin With maids to seem the lapwing and to jest, Tongue far from heart--play with all virgins so: I hold you as a thing ensky'd and sainted. By your renouncement an immortal spirit, And to be talk'd with in sincerity, As with a saint.

lines.speaker: isabella
lines.text: You do blaspheme the good in mocking me.

lines.speaker: lucio
lines.text: Do not believe it. Fewness and truth, 'tis thus: Your brother and his lover have embraced: As those that feed grow full, as blossoming time That from the seedness the bare fallow brings To teeming foison, even so her plenteous womb Expresseth his full tilth and husbandry.

lines.speaker: isabella
lines.text: Some one with child by him? My cousin Juliet?

lines.speaker: lucio
lines.text: Is she your cousin?

lines.speaker: isabella
lines.text: Adoptedly; as school-maids change their names By vain though apt affection.

lines.speaker: lucio
lines.text: She it is.

lines.speaker: isabella
lines.text: O, let him marry her.

lines.speaker: lucio
lines.text: This is the point. The duke is very strangely gone from hence; Bore many gentlemen, myself being one, In hand and hope of action: but we do learn By those that know the very nerves of state, His givings-out were of an infinite distance From his true-meant design. Upon his place, And with full line of his authority, Governs Lord Angelo; a man whose blood Is very snow-broth; one who never feels The wanton stings and motions of the sense, But doth rebate and blunt his natural edge With profits of the mind, study and fast. He--to give fear to use and liberty, Which have for long run by the hideous law, As mice by lions--hath pick'd out an act, Under whose heavy sense your brother's life Falls into forfeit: he arrests him on it; And follows close the rigour of the statute, To make him an example. All hope is gone, Unless you have the grace by your fair prayer To soften Angelo: and that's my pith of business 'Twixt you and your poor brother.

lines.speaker: isabella
lines.text: Doth he so seek his life?

lines.speaker: lucio
lines.text: Has censured him Already; and, as I hear, the provost hath A warrant for his execution.

lines.speaker: isabella
lines.text: Alas! what poor ability's in me To do him good?

lines.speaker: lucio
lines.text: Assay the power you have.

lines.speaker: isabella
lines.text: My power? Alas, I doubt--

lines.speaker: lucio
lines.text: Our doubts are traitors And make us lose the good we oft might win By fearing to attempt. Go to Lord Angelo, And let him learn to know, when maidens sue, Men give like gods; but when they weep and kneel, All their petitions are as freely theirs As they themselves would owe them.

lines.speaker: isabella
lines.text: I'll see what I can do.

lines.speaker: lucio
lines.text: But speedily.

lines.speaker: isabella
lines.text: I will about it straight; No longer staying but to give the mother Notice of my affair. I humbly thank you: Commend me to my brother: soon at night I'll send him certain word of my success.

lines.speaker: lucio
lines.text: I take my leave of you.

lines.speaker: isabella
lines.text: Good sir, adieu.
Exeunt
